Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.util

Class MapWriter

java.lang.Object
nl.naturalis.common.util.MapWriter
public final class MapWriter extends Object
Provides a convenient way of writing maps-within-maps (Map<String, Object> objects). It lets you write deeply nested values without having to create the intermediate maps first. If they are missing, they will be tacitly created.

Example 1:


 MapWriter mw = new MapWriter();
 mw.write("person.address.street", "12 Revolutionary Rd.")
  .write("person.address.state", "CA")
  .write("person.firstName", "John")
  .write("person.lastName", "Smith")
  .write("person.dateOfBirth", LocalDate.of(1967, 4, 4));
 Map<String, Object> map = mw.getMap();

Example 2:


 Map<String, Object> map = new MapWriter()
  .in("person")
    .write("firstName", "John")
    .write("lastName", "Smith")
    .write("dateOfBirth", LocalDate.of(1967, 4, 4))
    .in("address")
      .write("street", "12 Revolutionary Rd.")
      .write("state", "CA")
  .getMap();
Author:
Ayco Holleman

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    MapWriter.PathBlockedException
    Thrown if you try to write to a path that extends beyond a path that is set to a terminal value (a non-Map value).

  • Constructor Details

    • MapWriter

      public MapWriter()
      Creates a MapWriter that lets you start with a clean slate.

    • MapWriter

      public MapWriter(Map<String,Object> map)
      Creates a MapWriter that lets you start with the entries in the specified map. The map is read, but not modified.
      Parameters:
      map - The initial Map

  • Method Details

    • in

      public MapWriter in(String path)
      Starts a new (nested) map at the specified path, relative to the root path specified through the constructor. Intermediate maps will be created as and when necessary.
      Parameters:
      path - A path relative to the root path specified through the constructor
      Returns:
      This MapWriter

    • set

      public MapWriter set(String path, Object value)
      Sets the key corresponding to the specified path to the specified value. Intermediate maps will be created as and when necessary. It is not allowed to pass values of type Map or MapWriter. Use the in method to start a new Map. Null values are allowed.
      Parameters:
      path - The path at which to write the value
      value - The value
      Returns:
      This MapWriter

    • set

      public MapWriter set(Path path, Object value)
      Sets the key corresponding to the specified path to the specified value. Intermediate maps will be created as and when necessary. Values must not be instances of Map or MapWriter. Use the in method to start a new Map. Null values are allowed.
      Parameters:
      path - The path at which to write the value
      value - The value
      Returns:
      This MapWriter

    • isSet

      public boolean isSet(String path)
      Returns whether the specified path is set to a terminal value (and hence cannot be extended).
      Parameters:
      path - The path
      Returns:
      Whether it is set to a terminal value

    • getMap

      public Map<String,Object> getMap()
      Returns the Map resulting from the write actions. You can continue to use the MapWriter after a call to this method.
      Returns:
      The Map resulting from the write actions
